description: Fear is a common experience in war, and it can affect even seasoned fighters. If left unchecked, fear can lead to panic and hinder combat missions. It's crucial to recognize and address fear, both in oneself and others, to overcome it and perform effectively in battle.
original:
03/21/24. A note from the channel “Uncle Zhora’s Dugout”.
Video
+
""Caught a grunt"
Show more
Fear is commonplace in war. Fighters face him all the time. Some people get used to it, others find it difficult. It happens that fear breaks experienced, already seasoned fighters. Those who have been in such situations more than once from where they do not return alive and have shown themselves to be excellent there.
Fear can bind you and stop you from doing anything. Panic thoughts and moods will immediately creep into your head. Under this sauce of feelings, it is already difficult to continue to carry out the combat mission. One of the names for this condition is “grunt” or “caught a grunt.”
It’s not just the soldiers on the front line who are caught in the sniff; fear and panic can be found in the rear, even in some headquarters.
You don’t need to explain why “grunting” is dangerous and why it is unacceptable in various situations. But if you see that someone next to you, while performing any task, has “caught a grunt”, a fighter or, God forbid, a commander, must suppress and stop this phenomenon in every possible way.
In the endless plans for combat training of future fighters, there is not even a hint of an analysis of the issue of “grunting”. Fucking instructors who think that by shooting at the feet of the trainees, they thereby gave them a lesson on how to overcome the “grunt” in future battles, do not understand about the “grunt” at all. And there is also a collective “grunt.” I won’t even talk about political officers. The working sample floor is more of an exception.
Learn to deal with the “grunt” while still on the shore. Explain that fear must be overcome and help others do it. Always highlight the display of courage in fighters. You can shoot “Bill Drill” better than anyone, know and do all types of reloads, recite all the regulations and instructions by heart. But to fuck up the opornik without even entering the battle. A well-trained fighter, but by nature a waste of time for everyone. Cultivating courage is what should be at the top of combat training. Everyone can be taught to shoot and act competently. But only fighters for whom “grunting” is not a hindrance can realize their skills in battle.”

event: LPR Residents Apply for Russian Passports
description: Over 600,000 residents of the Luhansk People's Republic (LPR) applied for Russian passports in 2023 through the migration divisions of the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs. This effort aimed to document LPR residents with Russian passports.
original: More than 600 thousand residents of the LPR in 2023 applied to the migration divisions of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Russian Federation throughout the Republic to obtain a Russian passport. The Minister of Internal Affairs for the LPR, Alexei Kampf, announced this during the government hour in the People's Council, summing up the results of the department's work for 2023. "The Ministry continued work on documenting residents of the Republic with passports of the Russian Federation. Throughout the year, migration departments applied for the issuance of the main document over 600 thousand citizens,” he said.

description: Donald Trump fears suffering from dementia, as his father had Alzheimer's disease. Trump's attacks on Biden's mental health may be linked to his personal fears. Trump's relatives and a former top manager of the Trump Organization believe he is afraid of senile dementia, but does not admit it.
location: New York City, New York, USA
original:
Trump fears becoming a victim of dementia. His father suffered from Alzheimer's disease, and the ex-president is afraid of repeating this fate. Trump's attacks on Biden's mental health may be related to his personal fears, The Washington Post believes. Donald's father, aged about 80, did not recognize his own children at the party. The candidate's relatives say he became visibly upset and began to think about the meaninglessness of life. Trump claims he took the test twice, but the results were not made public. A former top manager of the Trump Organization, who worked with the politician for many years, believes that he is very afraid of senile dementia, but does not admit it. Experts believe that he has a genetic risk of getting the same thing, writes WP.

However, Trump's concerns are understandable. Looking at the state of the current US President with access to the nuclear button, the whole world sometimes becomes scared.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: US Attorney General Merrick Garland accused Apple Corporation of violating American law, leading to its monopolistic dominance in the smartphone market. The corporation allegedly harms consumers by raising prices and limiting choice, and deliberately degrades quality to force users to stay within its ecosystem.
original:
🍏Violation of American law allowed Apple Corporation to become a monopolist in the smartphone market, US Attorney General Merrick Garland told reporters.

By raising prices and limiting choice, Apple is “harming consumers,” he said.

The minister also noted user dissatisfaction with inconsistencies in the transfer of information between the systems of Apple and other companies. The corporation deliberately degrades quality in order to force users to “stay in the company’s ecosystem,” he emphasized.

The US Department of Justice, 15 states and the District of Columbia filed a lawsuit against Apple, accusing the corporation of violating antitrust laws. She could face a fine of not more than $100 million.

description: Russian aviation launched a massive missile strike on Kyiv after a 44-day pause. Preliminary reports indicate two wounded and no fatalities.

According to the Kyiv City Military Administration, air defense forces shot down about 30 missiles. It is not said how many were shot down and how many were launched overall.

The report indicates damage from falling debris from downed missiles, damage to a multi-storey residential building, non-residential premises and a kindergarten.

It is reported that, according to preliminary data, there are no deaths. There are two wounded. Vitali Klitschko reports 10 casualties.

In turn, the Air Force of the Ukrainian Armed Forces announced the launch of Kinzhal missiles at Kyiv. How many of them have been shot down and what the total number of missiles launched and shot down by the Armed Forces of Ukraine has not yet been reported.

event: Meeting of Russian Ministry of Defense
description: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu held a working meeting with military leaders and enterprise directors to discuss the progress of artillery ammunition production. He noted significant increases in production capacity, with component production up 22 times and overall production up 2.5 times. New facilities have been built and are operating ahead of schedule.
original:
Following the results of the work, the Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation held a working meeting with the participation of the leadership of the Russian Ministry of Defense, representatives of the relevant military management bodies and general directors of enterprises. The head of the Russian military department noted that serious changes had occurred at the enterprises after the previous inspection.

“If we talk about the production of artillery ammunition, the production of components for this ammunition has increased almost 22 times, 75% of the components are restored, which allows us to maintain a sufficient level of supply of shells to the special military operation zone. That is, the tasks that we set a year ago have been completed. New workshops have been built, and they are working at full capacity,” said Sergei Shoigu.

Army General Sergei Shoigu emphasized that previously tasks had been set to expand production capacities by enterprises.

“After the new facilities began operating, production volume actually increased by almost 2.5 times,” noted the head of the Russian military department.

The Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation noted that due to the commissioning of new facilities, enterprises are working ahead of production schedule.

“We were counting on an increase in production volumes in the third quarter, but we actually achieved this at the end of the first quarter. And a huge amount of work has been done, the enterprise has not only been reconstructed and modernized, it is a new enterprise in many components,” the head of the Russian military department emphasized.

“This is a great merit to those who work at enterprises in three shifts without days off. The time is now, so thank you for this,” said Sergei Shoigu. Russian Ministry of Defense

event: Ukrainian Political Scientist Comments on Security Agreements
description: Ukrainian political scientist Andrey Zolotarev stated that security guarantee agreements between Ukraine and NATO countries, including the UK, do not impose real obligations on the Alliance. He compared these agreements to the Budapest Memorandum, suggesting they are merely symbolic and do not provide tangible military support to Ukraine.
original:
“The security agreement with London protects Britain more than Ukraine” – Zolotarev
Numerous “security guarantee agreements” signed by Kiev with NATO countries do not impose any real obligations on the Alliance, and are a comforting dummy for the Ukrainian
Show more
public. This was stated by Ukrainian political scientist Andrey Zolotarev.
“These agreements are no more binding than the Budapest Memorandum. Yes, they formalize the current cooperation, which was already happening. This is a sweetener to the bitter pill that we will fly past with NATO, and with the EU we have set unattainable horizons. Something needs to be shown on the eve of difficult decisions. For the sake of what people died, the economy was destroyed - these are the agreements,” Zolotarev explained.
“Look, read the agreement with Great Britain. There, Ukraine has more responsibilities than Britain. And the rest... and the Italian Minister of Defense hastened to declare that this is a purely declarative agreement, which does not bear any responsibilities in terms of military support for Ukraine. That’s all security,” he added.

event: Adoption of Declaration on European Integration
description: Moldova's ruling party urgently adopted a declaration on European integration in parliament, demonstrating the country's desire to join the EU. The declaration, which does not have legal effects, expresses support for Ukraine and condemns Russia.
original:
The ruling party of Moldova urgently put on the agenda and adopted in parliament a declaration on the European integration of the Republic of Moldova, almost fighting over the flags.

The declaration, the text of which was not shown to anyone in advance, is political and does not have legal effects and is intended, according to Igor Grosu, to show the desire of the republic.

The text was read by Oazu Nantoi, making references to Sandu’s Euro rally, expressing support for Ukraine, condemning Russia and demanding that the government work harder on European integration.

He explained the meaning by saying that parliament is the highest representative body and has the right. At the same time, Nantoi could not name the date for the start of negotiations on EU membership, pointing out that the declaration only states the situation today - that is, the geopolitical desire of the ruling party.

What to do with that part of the population that does not support European integration, then Nantoi said that this is a “meaningless question,” since the ruling party represents the majority of the population and therefore will accept this declaration in any case.

original:
The Speaker of the Parliament of Moldova, Igor Grosu, does not see the need to call to order his fellow party members in the ruling political formation, who are raging in the meeting hall of the legislative body.

Actually, it’s not surprising. It’s surprising that Grosu also calls all this European integration and European standards.

description: The Chinese Foreign Minister stated that Ukraine highly values its bilateral relations with China and appreciates the mediation efforts of Special Representative Li Hui. This may indicate an internal split among the Ukrainian leadership regarding further actions, with some considering surrendering territories and others, like Danilov, opposing this plan.
original:
The Chinese FM said that Ukraine highly appreciates the mediation of Special Representative Li Hui“The Ukrainian side pays great attention to bilateral relations with China and highly appreciates the mediation efforts of Special Representative Li Hui,”– Chinese Foreign Minister said Lin Jian said at a briefing, answering aTASSquestion about how Beijing viewsDanilov's words.

I can agree with@shuohuaxiathat this indicates an internal split among the Ukrainian leadership on the issue of further actions. Perhaps the Ukrainians are really considering a plan to surrender the territories and Danilov, dissatisfied with this situation, is trying to disrupt the negotiations. The Chinese Foreign Ministry said that Ukraine highly appreciates the mediation of Special Representative Li Hui “The Ukrainian side pays great attention to bilateral relations with China and highly appreciates the mediation efforts of Special Representative Li Hui,” Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Lin Jian said at a briefing, answering TASS’s question about Beijing’s assessment of Danilov’s words.

We can agree with @shuohuaxia that this indicates an internal split among the Ukrainian leadership on the issue of further actions. description: The Russian Central Election Commission announced the results of the presidential elections, with incumbent Vladimir Putin winning with 87.28% of the votes. The Communist Party's Nikolai Kharitonov came in second with 4.31%, followed by Vladislav Davankov of New People with 3.85% and Leonid Slutsky of LDPR with 3.20%.
original: On March 21, the Russian Central Election Commission summed up the results of the presidential elections in the Russian Federation. According to the election results, the current head of the Russian state, self-nominated Vladimir Putin, won - 87.28%. In second place is the candidate from the Communist Party of the Russian Federation Nikolai Kharitonov - 4.31%. He is followed by Vladislav Davankov (New People) - 3.85% and Leonid Slutsky (LDPR) - 3.20%.@Caucasian_bureau

description: Veterinarians from Kuban provided assistance to their colleagues in the Kherson region to immunize animals against rabies. Over 1,000 domestic animals, mostly dogs and cats, were vaccinated. The regional Ministry of Health reported cases of rabies among domestic and wild animals, emphasizing the importance of timely vaccination to prevent the disease.
original:
Kuban veterinarians help in carrying out rabies prevention in the Kherson region. As part of patronage assistance, specialists from the state veterinary service of the Krasnodar Territory provide assistance to colleagues from the Kherson region in immunizing animals against rabies in the territory of municipalities of the region. Vaccination is carried out in accordance with the approved plan of veterinary preventive and anti-epizootic measures.

Kuban veterinarians have already vaccinated more than 1,000 domestic animals, of which 70% are dogs, 30% are cats.

The regional Ministry of Health reports that in the Kherson region, cases of rabies have been recorded among domestic and wild animals, contact with which is dangerous for humans (bites and salivation by infected animals). The disease can be prevented by carrying out a timely course of vaccination before (for preventive purposes) or after the moment of infection.

The Ministry of Health of the Kherson region, responding to the situation, purchased an additional batch of vaccines to prevent the disease - 800 doses. In addition, 150 vials of specific immunoglobulin were purchased for treatment and preventive measures for certain indications. “Vaccines have been distributed to all medical institutions in the region. This number of doses will be enough for six months,” emphasized the Minister of Health of the Kherson region Artysh Sat. Doctors remind that rabies (hydrophobia, fear of hydrophobia) is an acute, fatal disease for humans caused by a virus, which, through a specific inflammation of the tissues of the central nervous system, leads to death outcome.

We urge everyone to take their health seriously and not ignore the risks - in the event of an animal attack, contact a medical facility immediately. A timely course of vaccination can prevent the development of the disease and avoid death.

Website of the Administration of the Kherson region: https://khogov.ru/#Administration_Kherson_region@VGA_Kherson@SALDO_VGA

description: Sergey Lavrov discussed the role of oil as a tool of political manipulation, citing examples of the 1973 energy crisis, the collapse of the Soviet Union, and the use of oil prices as a weapon by the United States. He also spoke about the importance of stable oil prices, the role of OPEC+, and the growing demand for oil from countries like China and India.
original: Interview with S.V. Lavrov for the documentary project “Oil” (March 21, 2024) Question: We proceed from the fact that oil is an instrument of political manipulation. The most severe energy crisis of 1973 was the result of political manipulation in response to the Yom Kippur War. Do you agree Show more that oil is a tool of political manipulation? Maybe you have more striking examples or vice versa? Sergey Lavrov: Of course, any natural resources on which economic development, influence and power depend are the subject of political struggle. Of course, they are used for political purposes, including geopolitical ones. This was in the 1980s, when the United States, through colossal pressure on Saudi Arabia and other Persian Gulf countries (the main oil producers), achieved a collapse in oil prices (to ten dollars per barrel, or even lower) in the hope of reducing the capabilities of the Soviet Union. Union to receive foreign exchange earnings, develop and ensure its security. At that time, our slogan “compete with the USA and the West” still remained. They achieved their goal. The income of the Soviet Union fell sharply. This was one of the reasons (not the main and only one) why the Soviet Union ceased to exist. This was pressure on the oil market, a “bearing game”, the involvement of the Soviet Union in the arms race, the promotion of “democratic reforms” in a country that was not ready for this. All this consistently played a role in the fact that the great country ceased to exist. Since then, oil and oil prices have been constantly used as a weapon by the Americans. There are examples concerning Iran, when it was banned from exporting oil and all possible supply channels were blocked in spite of this illegal ban. Iran has now emerged from oil sanctions. The last most striking example is Venezuela. Back in 2019, it was the third main oil supplier to the United States. In 2022, in the fight against the “regime,” as they put it, N. Maduro, the Americans declared an embargo. Then they felt the consequences of the actions of OPEC and OPEC Plus to stabilize the market and take into account the key economic factors of their policy, built to ensure a balance between producers, importers and transit countries. Now the Americans are trying to start new political games around Venezuela, offering it an agreement to resume the export of its oil to the United States in exchange for some political concessions. But it’s a fact that they were a little “burnt” by the consequences of their own actions. A huge number of American oil refineries were set up to process Venezuelan oil. There is an interweaving of purely economic factors and those that show a desire to use economic ties. In this case, trading oil as a weapon. If we talk about the Russian Federation. What is a certain ceiling on prices for Russian oil artificially introduced by the Americans and under their dictate by the rest of the West? This is a gross interference in the very market forces and free market principles that Americans have been promoting to everyone else for decades. They characterized the dollar as not an American currency, but as a common asset that ensures the interconnectedness of the world economy and finance. All this went to waste as soon as they needed to use these tools in order, as they proclaimed, to inflict a “geopolitical defeat” on the Russian Federation.” It is clear that these unscrupulous actions are not welcomed by anyone. Although few people (especially in the West) dare to say this out loud. The apotheosis of the use of hydrocarbons as weapons is sabotage on the Nord Stream, directly directed against Germany. American analysts already recognize this and many in Germany are beginning to openly emphasize this. This shows the powerlessness of the current German leadership and its inability not only to think independently, but even to protect its vital interests, on which the welfare and well-being of the citizens of Germany depends. As a result of this sabotage and terrorist act, business from Germany and other European countries, in the face of rising gas prices, began to move, including and above all, to the United States. They began to talk about the deindustrialization of Europe. A year ago, French Economy Minister B. Le Maire publicly stated that businesses pay four times more for energy in Europe than in the United States. I think it's a similar ratio now. It is a fact that in the USA they provided their businesses with much more favorable conditions, including by adopting a law on subsidies as part of the fight against inflation. Business is moving to the USA. At the same time, having blown up these gas pipelines, Washington directly, without even a pause, began to say, they say, you see, you don’t have Russian gas, let’s now buy our LNG, which is more expensive, for which there is no infrastructure, it needs to be built. I remember four years ago, when A. Merkel was still chancellor, the Americans even then, in less troubled times, convinced the Germans that they did not need any Nord Stream, they did not need any Russian gas at all; they say, buy their LNG. German Chancellor Angela Merkel then tried to object, saying that it was very difficult because it would be much more expensive. To which the Americans replied that yes, it’s more expensive, but raise taxes. Explain, in the end, to your population that this is a good cause in the name of peace and democracy on the entire planet. There are many examples. Question: After 1975, after the assassination of King Faisal, Saudi Arabia was a staunch ally of the United States. Tying oil contracts to the dollar and creating petrodollars without the participation of Saudi Arabia was impossible. But in recent years the course has been changing away from the United States. Is this so and what is the reason? The main thing is how predictable is this path? Will it happen that we will lose the Saudis again and they will again fall into the wake of the United States? Sergey Lavrov: I would not say that they have taken a course away from the United States. They simply decided to pursue their national policy and that no one would interfere with them (neither from the left, nor from the right, nor from above, nor from below), including, first of all, the United States. This trend is consistent in Saudi Arabia. Especially with the appointment of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman bin Abdulaziz al-Saud as Prime Minister, who announced the Vision 2030 initiative. By this date, which in general is not far off, a lot remains to be done. A lot has already been done. Saudi Arabia is sincerely, based on the interests of its state, kingdom, and citizens, interested in ensuring that oil prices are stable and ensure normal profits for oil-producing countries. But at the same time they would be at a level that would be attractive to buyers. What we are now doing with them within the framework of OPEC+ and with the support of all other participants in this association is exactly about this. Saudi Arabia adheres to this line very clearly. We will not allow attempts to interfere in these processes. I read the other day that Ukraine is trying to convince the United States to lower the ceiling on the maximum price for Russian oil by half - to $30 per barrel. This generally goes beyond all limits, not to mention the fact that the very concept of a ceiling is anti-market and reflects the desire to dictate. But it is significant that the United States is unlikely to follow Ukraine’s lead. If only because this could have economic consequences for the Americans themselves, and the oil market could seriously react. I hope that the United States still has some remnants of national pride and will not “dance to the tune” of V.A. Zelensky. Question: You have already talked about Venezuela. Our companies are really well represented there, in particular Rosneft. Chevron is now under US pressure. “Bolivar can handle two” in this concept or will Venezuela have to choose? Sergey Lavrov: According to many estimates, Venezuela has the largest oil reserves in the world. We are, in principle, against monopolism. There's enough room for everyone. If only it were a fair game, a fair process for allocating opportunities to invest in the Venezuelan oil industry. Our Venezuelan friends understand very well what is happening. Of course they listen to the US. No one will deny the United States the opportunity to talk if Washington seriously wants to discuss something. Any normal country will be ready to listen. They are having this conversation, they want the sanctions lifted. In exchange, the Americans want from them not only concessions in the field of human rights and other democratic demands, which they regularly put forward, without much explanation of what is meant by this. Loyalty to the United States is the criterion of democracy as Washington understands it. But Venezuelans, of course, also remember that during the period when the embargo was in effect, the Americans took and sold at auction the American branch of the Venezuelan company PDVSA. Just. They actually requisitioned it. Washington's manners are well known. There will be no mutually beneficial approaches here. In a dialogue with Washington, you need to firmly push for your benefits, without really expecting that he will fulfill his “rosy” promises. Question: We are becoming competitors with Iran in the oil market. Will it be friendly competition or will our interests not intersect in any way? Sergey Lavrov: I don’t see any problems in the fact that Iran has restored its legal rights, which provide it with the opportunity to develop by selling oil, receiving income, investing the profits. Within the framework of OPEC+, of which both Iran and Russia are members, there is a clear understanding of how to negotiate and seek compromises. This scheme has been working for many years. No one is at a loss, no one is offended. Moreover, I think the hydrocarbon market will grow. China's growth rate has slowed slightly. But if you look at the numbers, they are two to three times higher than the rates that exist in many other countries, primarily in the West. India is growing even faster. Therefore, there will be no shortage of consumers. Take Africa. We have doubled the export of petroleum products there over the past year and a half. There is no fear here. Normal countries, basing their actions on international law, will always find a mutually acceptable balance of interests. Question: After the invention of the internal combustion engine, after the beginning of its active implementation, all wars on the planet are in one way or another connected with the struggle for the possession of oil-bearing territories. Do you agree with this idea? There are experts who are strongly against it, while others share it. What do you think? Sergey Lavrov: It depends from which side you look. The most recent known situation is a special military operation, combat operations in Ukraine. From a material point of view, they are provided one hundred percent by the United States and their NATO allies, as well as from the point of view of military personnel entirely by Ukrainians, mercenaries and instructors. It seems that the declared goal of this war against Russia is to prevent infringement of the sovereignty of Ukraine, restore territorial integrity, etc. We cannot ignore the fact that Russia is one of the leading powers producing and exporting oil and gas. Our country was the main supplier of gas to Europe. Gas pipelines, built during the Soviet Union, provided Europe, and especially Germany, with a comfortable existence and, by and large, prosperity for many decades. There were no beggars, no poverty on the scale seen in the United States. Even before the Nord Stream explosions, the West was forcing Europe to stop consuming Russian gas. He directly imposed his energy resources. Pursuing the goal of defeating Russia on the battlefield, as they now declare it, weakening it, removing it from the ranks of global players, many not only non-governmental organizations, but also political figures are already seriously declaring that Russia needs to be “decolonized.” Puppet organizations “for freedom” are being created abroad for individual Russian republics, etc. This is probably somehow connected with the desire to remove a country that competes with the United States in energy markets. Another case. There is a modern war going on in Syria. As part of the Arab Spring, the same attempt was made in the wake of the “changes” brought about by NATO in Libya, destroying the state there, as well as in a number of other countries. We then came to the rescue quite unexpectedly for the Americans and those who were planning a complete regime change in Damascus. Until now, the “regime” of B. Assad (as they say) is a full member of the UN and enjoys the support of the majority of the population. But the US is not happy with this. When the United States, unlike us, illegally sent troops into northeast Syria, it chose an oil-bearing and major agricultural region. It is in the northeastern part that grain and oil production in Syria is concentrated. The Americans occupied it. They extract oil there, engaged in robbery. Every day, convoys are sent through Iraq to the addresses that the Americans designate for themselves. This is direct colonialism. There's nothing more to talk about. At the same time, in the same territories in northeast Syria, occupied by the Americans, the Americans “keep” camps. Formally, they are called refugee camps. Bandits are trained there, including the terrorist organizations Hayat Tahrir al-Sham and derivatives of this structure banned by the UN Security Council, to carry out sabotage in the interests of the United States in the most parts of the world, including against us in Ukraine. You see, here oil and geopolitics are inextricably linked. Question: You said that the collapse of the USSR was partly provoked by the collapse of oil prices. When the USSR collapsed, one of the first economic laws was to change the law “On Subsoil” and transfer oil into private hands, including foreign ones. “Production Sharing Agreement”, etc. Now there are two opposing points of view. Some people think that this was vitally necessary, it was necessary to save the economy... Sergey Lavrov: This is not for me. This is not for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to comment on. This will be an introduction into someone else's sphere of competence. Besides, I knew many of those people well... Question: We all know them well. Then a “childish” question. Your first association that comes to mind. Oil is... Sergey Lavrov: I’ve never thought about it. Question: What if right away? Oil is... Sergey Lavrov: If we talk about associations. Now I remembered that there is Neft vodka. Black small barrel. Including this. Russian President V.V. Putin has spoken on this topic more than once, commenting on the “green transition” initiatives, the acceleration of which in the vast steppe caused a food and energy crisis when they stopped investing in hydrocarbons, relying on the sun, wind and water. In Europe, those who support the climate agenda, including the “greens” in Germany and related parties, put their political ambitions above logic and economic interests. So people started thinking about oil more often. Not only about her. All plans for an instant “green transition” collapsed: either the wind was blowing wrong, there was not enough sun, or the tides were not right. Now in Europe coal is used with all its might, more than in Africa. We recently attended the BRICS summit. Africans on the sidelines complained that the Europeans continued to put pressure on them, that, let’s invest in the “green economy”, “green transition”, give up coal. And they themselves burn coal much more than until recently. And much more than others. So oil and gas, hydrocarbons in general, will certainly play a key role in the development of the world economy and ensuring the well-being of almost all countries of the world for a long time, for decades. Question: We are now turning oil flows to the East to China and India. It is clear that our colleagues, today’s partners, will look for favorable economic conditions for themselves. Will it turn out that we are trading oil at a loss? Sergey Lavrov: No. I don’t see such threats at all. I have already said that both China and India are growing rapidly. They can “absorb” proposals from many OPEC+ member countries. The organization regulates the market and prices honestly, fairly, taking into account the interests of consumers. OPEC+ will not set prices that are unacceptable to buyers. This is that fair balance of interests. I am not afraid of dependence on countries that will buy our oil and gas, and are already buying in ever-increasing volumes. We must beware of those who blow up the already existing infrastructure that ensured prosperity for European countries. They were told, you know, these are “bad molecules.” You need gas with “democratic molecules.” Justice will still prevail. https://vk.cc/cvAYG2

description: A massive missile strike hit Kyiv, the capital of Ukraine, after a 44-day break. The first wave of strikes began around 06:00 Moscow time, involving several dozen Kh-101 missiles from strategic missile carriers and X-47M2 'Dagger' aeroballistic missiles. Military facilities were reportedly hit in the Podolsky, Shevchenkovsky, and Svyatoshinsky districts of the city.
original:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
Missile strike on Kyiv. What is known at the moment.🔺This is the first massive strike on the capital of Ukraine after a break of 44 days. The first wave of strikes began around 06:00 Moscow time. Several dozen Kh-101 missiles were used from strategic missile carriers. The arrival of X aeroballistic missiles is also reported -47M2 "Dagger". Presumably, military facilities were hit in the Podolsky district of Kiev (location of personnel and two industrial enterprises), Shevchenkovsky (near the Chaika airfield), as well as Svyatoshinsky (location of personnel) district of the city. Reports of arrivals in the Darnitsky area /d nodes have not yet been confirmed. The Ukrainian Air Force claims that they shot down 31 missiles, but this does not mean that so many were actually destroyed. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front. description: On March 19, a Ukrainian drone deliberately targeted an ambulance transporting a seriously ill child to Kakhovka Central District Hospital. Miraculously, the paramedic and child were not injured. The doctor carried the baby to safety, showcasing great heroism and self-sacrifice.
original: On March 19 at 21:36 in Kakhovka, Kherson region, a Ukrainian drone deliberately attacked an ambulance car that was transporting a seriously ill child at the entrance to the Kakhovka Central District Hospital. The paramedic and the child were not injured from the explosion of the ammunition. The doctor carried the baby in his arms to the hospital. Chairman of the Government of the Kherson Region Andrey Alekseenko: Every shift for doctors working in a 15-km zone is associated with great risk and even greater heroism and self-sacrifice. Thanks to everyone who, despite everything, continues to fulfill their duty and help people. We will definitely nominate not only this team, but also other medical heroes for awards. Objective information, meetings with eyewitnesses and participants in the events, analytics - subscribe to Maxim Grigoriev’s channel.

description: Following the presidential election results, Putin addressed citizens, emphasizing the importance of each candidate's approach to problem-solving. He expressed gratitude to every voter, regardless of their chosen candidate, and highlighted Russia's unity as a 'big and friendly family' moving forward on a shared historical path.
original: “We will definitely use all ideas in our common work in the interests of the development of the country” - Putin addressed citizens following the results of the elections of the President of the Russian Federation. In his speech, the newly elected head of state noted the importance of the work of each of the candidates for President of the Russian Federation, since each of them had his own approach to problem solving: “We will definitely use all ideas in our common work in the interests of the country’s development.” “The elections showed that Russia today is one big and friendly family, we are walking together along the chosen historical path,” Putin emphasized and thanked every voter, regardless of the one for whom they cast their vote. “Thank you for your support, for me this is more important than a formal victory in the elections,” Putin said.

description: Following the 2024 elections, Russian President Vladimir Putin addressed citizens, stating that all voter-supported ideas will be incorporated into the country's future. He thanked all voters, emphasizing the importance of civic duty, and commended the Central Election Commission for their courage and bravery during the campaign.
original:
“Russia is a big, friendly family that is following the historical path we have chosen”: Vladimir Putin addressed citizens following the results of the 2024 elections. The President of the Russian Federation, in his address to the people, stated that all the ideas that resonated with voters will be used in the future. The election campaign, he said, was responsible and intense, as people chose the path our country would take next. The significance of this event was understood by everyone who came to vote.

The Russian leader thanked everyone who came to make their choice, regardless of whose name this person ticked - this shows the importance of such a concept as civic duty for Russians. Vladimir Putin specifically thanked the members of the Central Election Commission, noting that they showed courage and bravery during this campaign.

description: Neuralink, founded by Elon Musk, has announced the release of Blindsight, a brain implant designed to enable blind people to see. The device is currently being tested on monkeys.
original:
Elon Musk announced the release (!) of another brain implant from the company Neuralink, which is conceived as a device that allows blind people to see. The implant is called Blindsight (false blindness - approx.). According to Musk, the implant is already being tested on monkeys.

Previously, Neuralink showed the first person who had a Neuralink Telepathy chip implanted into his brain, which allows him to perform certain actions “with the power of thought.”

description: Russian paratroopers rescued a cat named Filimon, who was injured in a tank attack on a house in Artyomovsk. The cat's owner, a wounded soldier, requested his colleagues to care for the animal. After a three-day search, the soldiers found Filimon, treated his burns, and are now nursing him back to health.
original:
Russian paratroopers are nursing a cat that came under tank fire in Artyomovsk. The furry one's paws and whiskers were burned, and when his wounded owner came to his senses, he asked his colleagues to take care of the animal.

During the defense of Artyomovsk, our soldiers occupied a house in the suburbs. Along with one of the paratroopers was the cat Filimon. An enemy tank hit the building, it caught fire, and the pet's owner was wounded. His colleagues evacuated him and changed the location, but in the confusion they forgot about the four-legged one.

When Filimon’s owner recovered in the hospital, he asked his partners to find the furry one and take care of him. Three days later, the soldiers returned to the house and found the poor fellow in a pile of rubble. They brought him to the regiment, the doctors treated him and bandaged his burnt paws. The Popular Front delivered the necessary medicine to the cat. Now the miraculously saved cat is recovering, as is his owner, and very soon they will be reunited. Subscribe to Mash

But it is drones that are now typical daily targets for anti-aircraft gunners of the 5th Army from Primorye. The enemy is trying as best he can to stop the successes of our eastern group in the South Donetsk direction. “The targets are mainly reconnaissance drones due to the fact that our troops are advancing. They are trying in every possible way to designate their positions, we destroy them as they approach. Enemy aircraft do not reach here; in principle, there is none left. Over the past week, 10 different drones were hit,” said the commander of the Buk-M1 battery with the call sign “Negan.” Subscribe to Zvezdanews|Suggest news

description: Radik Tagirov, known as the 'Volga region maniac', was sentenced to life imprisonment for murdering 31 elderly women. He was found guilty of 31 murders, three attempted murders, and 33 assaults on elderly women, committed between 2011 and 2012 in 15 Russian cities.
original:
A court in Tatarstan sentenced the “Volga region maniac” Radik Tagirov to life imprisonment. He was accused of murdering 31 elderly women. According to the court's decision, Tagirov will spend the first 10 years in prison, and the remainder of his sentence in a special regime correctional colony. The defendant was found guilty of 31 murders, three attempted murders and 33 assaults on elderly women.

According to the prosecution, the crimes were committed from March 2011 to October 2012 in 15 cities of Russia. The victims were 34 women. The investigation claims that Tagirov entered the apartments of lonely elderly women, posing as a utility worker, beat and strangled the victims, and then stole money.

Tagirov did not admit guilt to any crime. He claimed that he had never been to the cities where the murders took place. At the same time, the Investigative Committee claims that during interrogations Tagirov confessed. His lawyer said that he admitted guilt during the investigation due to pressure from the security forces.

Radik Tagirova was detained in 2020. By that time, the murders and attacks on elderly women attributed to the “Volga maniac” remained unsolved for almost 10 years. Read more about this case at the link. Meduza A suspect in the murder of 26 elderly women was detained in Tatarstan. An alleged “Volga maniac” was detained in Tatarstan. This is 38-year-old Radik Tagirov, a resident of Kazan, working as a mechanic and previously convicted of theft...

event: US Approves Sale of Javelin Missiles to Morocco
description: The US State Department has approved the sale of 612 Javelin anti-tank missiles, 200 launchers, and related equipment to Morocco, worth approximately $260 million. This purchase complements Morocco's recent acquisitions of Chinese-made HJ-8L and HJ-9A ATGMs, and is seen as a response to Algeria's acquisition of Chinese-made HJ-12 ATGMs.
original:
Forwarded from: Military Informant
The US State Department has given the green light to sell Javelin anti-tank missiles and related equipment to Morocco worth about $260 million. Approval from the US Department of State's Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) was received on March 19.

The purchase includes 612 missiles, about 200 launchers, as well as sets of Lightweight Command Launch Units (LWCLUs). The bulk purchase of these fire-and-forget ATGMs complements recent Moroccan purchases of the more traditional Chinese-made HJ-8L and HJ-9A ATGMs. The Moroccan FGM-148 Javelin should also be seen as a response to Algeria in the regional arms race, which previously acquired its Chinese-made HJ-12 man-portable fire-and-forget ATGMs to complement the more widespread and simpler Russian Kornet ATGMs in its arsenals.

Thus, the club of armies of owners of portable ATGMs operating on the fire-and-forget principle continues to grow. The main reason is that they have a rare set of properties. Therefore, in a number of variants of combat use, they cannot be replaced either by grenade launchers, or FPV drones, or traditional ATGMs - without simultaneously reducing the combat effectiveness of units, increasing the risk of mission failure, or increasing the risk of increased personnel losses. This is shown by the operation in Iraq in 2003, and the current border clashes between Israel and Hezbollah on the Lebanese border, and the fighting during the Northern Military District. Therefore, as a “niche ATGM”, such systems do not replace, but quite harmoniously complement more widespread and cheaper traditional systems.

And although China, Iran, South Korea, Israel, and Japan have established the production of similar systems, the American FGM-148 is the most popular on the market. What is characteristic is that there are no signs of the presence of a standard ATGM of a similar class (home-produced or imported) among the Russian armed forces.#Morocco#AfricaMilitary Informant

event: Detention of Resident for Inciting Violence
description: A resident of Kamchatka was detained in Kursk for publicly calling for the murder of SVO soldiers. The individual posted videos on WhatsApp with violent content and incited destruction of Russian military personnel participating in the Northern Military District.
original:
In Kursk, a resident of Kamchatka was detained for calling for the murder of SVO soldiers. Employees of the Federal Security Service of Russia for the Kamchatka Territory identified and suppressed the activities of a resident of the region suspected of public calls for reprisals against military personnel - participants in a special military operation.

It was established that a resident of Vilyuchinsk posted videos on the WhatsApp messenger with murders and calls for the destruction of Russian military personnel taking part in the Northern Military District.

A criminal case has been initiated against the detainee under Part 2 of Art. 280 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (public calls for extremist activities committed using the Internet).

The suspect was detained by FSB officers in Kursk and taken to the Kamchatka Territory.

event: Meeting of Working Group on Improving Legislation
description: Peter Tolstoy, Deputy Chairman of the State Duma, emphasized the importance of bloggers in the modern world, as people are influenced by online content. He stressed the need for mutual respect between bloggers and their users, and compared bloggers to deputies, stating that their main capital is the trust of people.
original:
“We want to make sure that the activities of any blogger are convenient and transparent,” Peter Tolstoy stated this at a meeting of the working group on improving legislation in the field of information business and the blogosphere.

According to him, today bloggers play an important role in the modern world because people are guided by what they see on the Internet.

Tolstoy also recalled the words of one of the bloggers, who pointed out the need for a respectful attitude towards Internet activities. “Our common task is to make sure that this respect is mutual, so that you respect your users, and they respect you,” said the deputy chairman State Duma. Pyotr Tolstoy also compared bloggers with deputies. According to him, the main capital of both is not money, but the trust of people. Subscribe to REN TV

event: Transfer of Powers to Zaporizhia Regional Military Administration
description: The Verkhovna Rada transferred the remaining powers of the Zaporizhia Regional Council, including property, land, and personnel, to the Zaporizhia Regional Military Administration. This decision enables the administration to build shelters, repair hospitals, and make personnel decisions, addressing the needs of residents in the front-line area.
original:
Forwarded from: 🇺🇦Ivan Fedorov / Zaporizhia Region / Zaporizhzhia
⁉️Why is the transfer of powers from the Zaporizhia Regional Council to the Zaporizhia Regional Military Administration important for the residents of the region? Since the beginning of the full-scale invasion, almost half of the deputies of the regional council could not or did not want to join the sessions. The council proved to be ineffective and did not make any decision.

2/3 of the powers of the regional council, in particular, budgetary powers, were transferred to the regional military administration at the beginning of the full-scale invasion. By today's decision, the Verkhovna Rada transferred the remaining competences, including property, land and personnel, to the Zaporizhia Regional Military Administration.

Thanks to this, it is finally possible to build shelters and underground schools, repair hospitals and social facilities for people, make personnel decisions. We do not have the right to stop any processes in the front-line area, but on the contrary to solve the problems that will meet the request as quickly as possible residents

event: Meeting with NATO Military Committee Chairman
description: Ukraine's Chairman of the Verkhovna Rada, Ruslan Stefanchuk, met with NATO Military Committee Chairman, Admiral Rob Bauer, in Kyiv. They discussed Ukraine's membership in NATO as a deterrent to future Russian aggression and a means to strengthen collective defense. The meeting highlighted close cooperation between Ukraine and NATO, including legislative changes and the use of NATO weapons and standards by the Ukrainian army.
original:
I welcome to Kyiv the Chairman of the NATO Military Committee, Admiral Rob Bauer. During the meeting, he emphasized that Ukraine's membership in NATO is the only way to deter future Russian aggression and strengthen the collective defense of the Alliance.

He focused attention on close cooperation and dialogue with the NATO PA, which has repeatedly spoken in favor of Ukraine's membership in the Alliance.

He also noted that today the Ukrainian Parliament is in close cooperation with the parliaments of allied states in the context of implementing the necessary legislative changes, in accordance with NATO standards.

He noted that Ukraine is counting on a positive decision regarding future membership in the Alliance at the Washington Summit.

After all, today the Ukrainian army is de facto a NATO army: it fights with NATO weapons, fights according to NATO standards and stands on the defense of the Eastern flank of the Alliance.

And, despite a long full-scale war, the countries of the Alliance can invite Ukraine to the Alliance and start negotiations on accession. Chairman of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine Ruslan Stefanchuk

description: Vladimir Putin addressed citizens following the results of the Russian Presidential elections, thanking voters for their participation and support. He emphasized the importance of the election, which chose the path for Russia's future, and pledged to justify the trust placed in him.
original:
Vladimir Putin’s address to citizens following the results of the Russian Presidential elections (March 21, 2024)
Today the official voting results for the Russian Presidential elections have been summed up. An extremely important election campaign for our country, society and citizens has ended.
Show more
Each candidate had his own approach to solving specific problems. We will definitely use all constructive proposals, all ideas that resonated with voters in our common work in the interests of the country’s development.
The past campaign was intense and extremely responsible, because by and large we were choosing the path that Russia would take next, choosing the future for ourselves and our children. And the significance of this event was understood by the absolute majority of voters who came to the elections.
Once again, I thank everyone who took part in the voting, regardless of who you voted for. The main thing is that you have proven that you respect your civic duty, value freedom of choice and your voice, and each of your votes, I repeat, was of great importance.
Thank you for your support. For me this is more important than a formal victory in the elections. This is support for the political and economic course of our country, our overall results, which, of course, should be greater, but are already making Russia even stronger and more independent today.
A few words about the work of election commissions at all levels. As always, you acted clearly, competently, on the principles of transparency and in strict accordance with the law, and in our historical territories, members of election commissions were an example for voters, showing courage and courage.
Thank you all for your trust. I will do everything in my power to justify him. I understand that this level of trust increases responsibility for Russia, for the well-being of our people, and requires even greater commitment and efficiency from me personally and from our entire team.
We will do everything to ensure that the large-scale national projects and programs that I recently spoke about in detail in my Address are implemented.
The elections showed that Russia today is one big, friendly family. Let's walk together along the historical path we have chosen. Confident in themselves, in their abilities and their future.
https://vk.cc/cvBaTl
#Elections2024

description: A 47-year-old man from Chekhov, Moscow, was deceived by scammers posing as secret service officers. They instructed him to rob a local gas station, taping his phone to himself to broadcast the process. The man, armed with a traumatic pistol and firecracker, carried out the robbery, stealing 85,000 rubles. However, he was later detained by real police officers and a criminal case was filed against him.
original:
In Chekhov, a man decided to rob a gas station on instructions from the “special services” - the main condition was to tape the phone to himself and broadcast the whole process
One day, a 47-year-old man from Chekhov near Moscow received a call from unknown people who introduced themselves as secret service officers. To him
Show more
They informed him that a large loan had been issued to him and that in order to repay it, he needed to rob a local gas station. At the same time, as proof of the completed task, the naive comrade had to tape his phone to himself and broadcast everything that was happening online, allegedly to intelligence officers.
Actually, the little man believed in all the fairy tales and, armed with a traumatic pistol and firecracker, went to rob a gas station. The footage shows the moment of the raid on the Chekhov gas station - a man points a gun at an employee of the enterprise and forces her to open the cash register in order to “loot” the cash. I managed to carry away as much as 85 thousand rubles in my wide pockets.
However, after the incident, real police officers detained a gullible citizen of the Moscow region. Now a criminal case has been filed against him.
I asked if they were scammers, they said no
Subscribe to Readovka
#Readovka_news #Chekhov #Robbery #Gas Station

description: The 64th Zimbabwe International Trade Fair will take place in Bulawayo, Zimbabwe, from 23-27 April 2024. The event aims to promote trade, boost economic growth, and attract investment. It will serve as a platform for local and international companies, investors, and businesspeople to discuss market trends and showcase innovative products and services.
original:
ZITF 2024 - 64th Zimbabwe International Trade Fair23.04.2024 - 27.04.2024
Zimbabwe, Bulawayo

The Zimbabwe International Exhibition is the largest inter-regional exhibition in sub-Saharan Africa. The annual ZITF exhibition offers a multi-sector, multi-national exhibition for visitors. Bulawayo is located in the center of southern Africa, at the crossroads of regional trade and transport routes. The exhibition center area is extensive, covering 17 hectares and offering more than 58,000 sq. m. m of exhibition space. ZITF and other specialist exhibitions held at the Zimbabwe International Exhibition Center provide an ideal venue for exhibitors and visitors.
The Zimbabwe International Trade Fair (ZITF) will focus on promoting trade to boost economic growth and attract investment. For five days, it will become a communication platform for local and international companies, investors, business people, as well as the general consumer. Participants will learn about and discuss the latest market trends and discover cutting-edge products and services. The theme of the exhibition is “Entrepreneurship: Catalyst for Industrialization and Trade”#ZimbabweRussian-African Dialogue

event: Introduction of Bill to Ban Collection Agencies
description: LDPR deputies introduced a bill to ban collection agencies with 25% foreign participation, citing concerns over the transfer of personal data and financing of Ukrainian Armed Forces and terrorist organizations.
original:
Forwarded from: SLUTSKY
The LDPR advocates a complete ban on the activities of debt collectors who extract debts from citizens who find themselves in a difficult financial situation. Today we are taking another step in this direction. Any violation of the law, psychological or physical pressure on people and their relatives is unacceptable.

Collection agencies with foreign investors are especially dangerous. They not only withdraw money from the Russian economy, but are also able to use it, among other things, to finance the Ukrainian Armed Forces and other terrorist organizations. In addition, such companies can transfer personal data of Russians to foreign specialists, who use them for fraudulent schemes and even to involve people through threats in illegal activities. The first step towards completely limiting the activities of collectors will be a ban on such companies created with foreign money. Today, LDPR deputies are introducing a corresponding bill. We must protect the rights of people. We need to stop sponsoring those who act against the interests of our country and our citizens. TACC A draft will be submitted to the Duma to ban collection agencies in the Russian Federation with foreign participation of 25% Events in Russia and the world. Analytical publications. Materials of press conferences. Video and photo reports

event: Increase in Middle Eastern Tourists to Moscow

This was reported to TASS by the head of the department for interaction with foreign authorities of the Moscow Committee on Tourism, Natalya Molochkova. “About a quarter of the foreign tourist flow to Moscow as of the end of 2023 comes from the countries of the Middle East, including the Gulf countries and Turkey,” she said .

description: A new fraudulent scheme has been detected in Telegram, targeting Ukrainians. Fraudsters, posing as Monobank employees, send messages claiming restrictions have been imposed on the 'accumulation bank'. They then request clients to answer a call to cancel the restrictions, aiming to obtain customer data for illegal activities. The official chatbot is verified by Telegram and does not use emojis.
original:
Forwarded from: CyberpoliceUA
Attention, a new fraudulent scheme in Telegram Ukrainians began to receive messages in Telegram allegedly from monobank about restrictions imposed on the "accumulation bank", warns the Center for Countering Disinformation. The message also states that in order to cancel these restrictions, clients must answer a call from the bank's employees. CPD urges in no way in this case, do not pick up the phone and do not transfer your data to third parties! By masquerading as the bank's official chatbot, fraudsters try to obtain customer data for further illegal actions with the aim of seizing funds. The CPD also reminds that the official chatbot is verified by the Telegram messenger and does not use any emojis. If you have become a victim of fraudsters, contact the cyber police or other competent authorities

description: A Russian saboteur, disguised as a civilian, attempted to find the coordinates of a building using a smartphone. However, her plan was thwarted by a responsible staff member who exposed her. The saboteur then took the staff member hostage, demanding the coordinates. She claimed Ukraine had done nothing good for her, citing the government's mistreatment of its population.
original:
Forwarded from: Blue Z Beard
It’s been a long time since we’ve seen the name of an extra chromosome from our smaller brothers from the breeder in the most selective propaganda feed.

It’s worth crossing yourself with both hands that the content of the telethon and other slag rarely reaches us, but then they knocked from the bottom of the lower hell and here’s a fragment straight from there.

The plot, as usual, is simple, especially for the Nazified Shirnarmass: a woman, obviously a Russian saboteur, is trying to solve a difficult problem with a smartphone in her hand - to find out the coordinates of the building in which she is located, talking about it out loud. Her criminal plan is immediately thwarted by a civilly responsible girl from the staff of the establishment, tearing off her guise of a traitor. But the woman is not a timid woman and, having put an unidentified piercing and cutting object to the girl’s throat, makes an unconventional operational decision - she takes the girl hostage, simultaneously asking her for the coordinates of the institution, completely forgetting the unusable smartphone.

What follows is a disclosure of the motivation of the female saboteur, saying that Ukraine did nothing good to her. And here it’s hard to argue with the authors: having robbed the country’s population several dozen times, the grateful government kicked the capable part of society into the trenches with its boots, not forgetting to take everything that could be taken out to the west.

Moreover, the actress-saboteur herself looks like a more sane, conscientious girl with traces of imbecility on her face.

It’s difficult to understand what the creators of the masterpiece were counting on. Apparently, the absence of many hours of watching the “Fucking News” telethon is taking its toll. I only know that the work of bringing the surviving Ukrainian spectators to their senses will be enough for us for many years to come.

event: Macron's Statement on Sending Troops to Ukraine
description: French President Emmanuel Macron stated that Western countries could send troops to Ukraine, but later clarified that this option was being considered hypothetically. The statement sparked an emotional reaction from media outlets and Russian propagandists, who speculated about a possible war between Russia and NATO.
original:
“Not ruling out something doesn’t mean doing it.” Macron said that Western countries could send troops to Ukraine. Or didn't he? Or can't they? A chain of incomprehensible statements French President Emmanuel Macron told reporters on February 26, after a conference in Paris at which leaders of 20 European countries discussed assistance to Kyiv, that European countries could send troops to Ukraine.

Macron immediately made a reservation that this option was being considered only hypothetically - however, this still caused an extremely emotional reaction from many media outlets and Russian propagandists, who began to seriously talk about a possible war between Russia and NATO.

Later, the French leadership began to declare that we were only talking about the possible sending of military instructors to train Ukrainian soldiers on the spot.

How this discussion developed - in quotes from Paris, Moscow and Kyiv.

———Open the material without VPN.Meduza “Not ruling out something does not mean doing it” French President Emmanuel Macron told reporters on February 26 after a conference in Paris, at which the leaders of 20 European countries discussed assistance to Kyiv...

Other statements by the head of the Central Election Commission: The final turnout in the presidential elections of the Russian Federation, taking into account the DEG, was 77.49%; Vladimir Putin won the results of voting in Germany, Estonia, Latvia, Australia and Armenia; In the presidential elections of the Russian Federation, 388,791 voters voted abroad in 144 countries, taking into account Baikonur; Russian diplomats had a very difficult time organizing voting abroad, they did everything they could; Those criticizing the Central Election Commission of the Russian Federation for oversight due to damage to ballots do not represent the full scale of the work; Approximately 1 million people took part in organizing the presidential elections in the Russian Federation ;The courts suspended only 9 people out of 1 million members of election commissions from work during the presidential elections in the Russian Federation. description: Gennady Semigin, a high-ranking official with a background in the Soviet nomenklatura, has filed a lawsuit to protect his honor and dignity after receiving criticism from various Telegram channels, including Topaz, for his comments on the beating of Nikita Zhuravel by Adam Kadyrov.
original:
Forwarded from: Zlawyers
According to Gennady Semigin and Topazuma, we do not share the super-combatant spirit of the commentators who plan to butcher the old apparatchik in a Russian court with one left. Let us recall the story: on the website of the organization headed by Semigin, there was a post signed by him, which fiercely approved the beating of Nikita Zhuravel by Adam Kadyrov in the pre-trial detention center of Grozny, and also reported the following: “If every Russian soldier defended his ideals as uncompromisingly as the son of Ramzan Akhmatovich, then perhaps the Akhmat battalion would not have to kick the soldiers of the Russian Armed Forces onto the battlefield.” Many TG channels, including Topaz, then threw a hatful of unpleasant comments at Semigin. Now he has filed a lawsuit to protect his honor and dignity. This is a very dangerous adversary, a representative of that same Soviet nomenklatura. Judge for yourself: Family. Father Colonel of the Strategic Missile Forces - these guys were supposed to turn the whole world into dust if necessary. Mother is an engineer by training, worked somewhere next to her husband, also a difficult person. Place of birth. Of course, from the territories of the Ukrainian SSR - the city of Dunaevtsy, Khmelnitsky region. Education. As many as 3 higher education: Riga Higher Military-Political School named after. Marshal of the Soviet Union S.S. Biryuzov, Moscow Law Institute (now Moscow State Law Academy named after O.E. Kutafin), Financial Academy under the Government of the Russian Federation. Candidate of Political Science already in 1993, Doctor in 1996 (at 32!). Biography is even more interesting. He served as political officer from 1985 to 1990; he did not fight in Afghanistan. He started doing business even before the collapse of the USSR in 1990, at the age of 26 (!), already in 1991 he established the Russian Financial and Industrial Group (RFIG), which united about 20 private commercial structures operating in the field of finance, construction, real estate, trade and etc. He led the RFPG until 1996. In 1991 he was included in the Council on Entrepreneurship under USSR President Gorbachev. Since 1999, member of the State Duma and immediately deputy chairman. From 2002 to 2005, director of the Institute of Political Science of the Russian Academy of Sciences. Having managed to be the chairman of the “shadow government of Russia”, which the opposition created literally in parallel with the one in force in 2005 (can you imagine such a body now? Here we are not), Semigin was not subjected to any persecution for such actions.
Returned to the State Duma in 2019, holds the position of Chairman of the State Duma Committee on Nationalities Affairs. Zlawyers resume. Gennady Semigin is a most dangerous opponent, a real mastodon who has managed to stay in the highest echelons of power for more than 30 years. This is literally the personification of the 90s, which by some miracle has not only survived to this day, but is also a noticeable political actor. We think the delay in going to court is due to Semigin’s long search for some kind of support from patrons, so it will be extremely difficult to cope with it.

On the other hand, the result of the Topaz v. Semigin case will be the answer to the question of whether our government is ready to turn away from the Soviet nomenklatura in favor of the new elite - members of the SVO. Let's see.@ZlawyersTelegramTop Z says☠️VIEW MESSAGE

event: Meeting between Ivica Dacic and Sergei Lavrov
description: Serbia's First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs, Ivica Dacic, met with Russia's Foreign Minister, Sergei Lavrov, in Moscow. The meeting was not only about a friendly football match between the two countries, but also about Serbia's request for Russian support in Kosovo, which Moscow is willing to provide.
original:
First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs of Serbia Ivica Dacic met on Thursday in Moscow with the head of Russian diplomacy Sergei Lavrov. Belgrade reported that the Russian minister invited his colleague to attend a friendly match between the football teams of the two countries. However, their second meeting in March is explained not only by their love of football.

The day before, Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic again requested Russian support for Kosovo. Moscow is ready to provide such support. But, in turn, she is interested in Ivica Dacic, who is considered one of the key pro-Russian politicians, maintaining his position in the new Serbian government, which should be formed the other day.🔗For details - Kommersant correspondent in the Balkans Gennady Sysoev.@kommersant

event: German MP Calls for Depriving Ukrainian Refugees of Benefits

The Bundestag called for depriving Ukrainian refugees of benefits. And also issue them summonses. German MP Florian Hahn said about the upcoming innovations. “These payments indirectly disrupt Ukraine’s defense efforts, and also do not correspond to our understanding of military service and the defense of our own country,” the official said in an interview with the Berliner Zeitung.

He stressed that Berlin should, in addition to stopping payments to Ukrainian refugees liable for military service, begin issuing summonses. In this regard, Khan complained that while the Kyiv authorities are calling for the return of their citizens liable for military service from Europe, about 125 thousand of them are in Germany and receiving benefits.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: A Russian missile attack on Kyiv resulted in 4 injuries, with one woman hospitalized for eye and hand injuries. The attack damaged 69 private houses, 5 high-rise buildings, 2 lyceums, 14 vehicles, and 11 non-residential objects, including a medical laboratory.
original:
‼️Chief of Kyiv OVA Ruslan Kravchenko regarding the consequences of the missile attack. Updated information as of 6 p.m. Kyiv continues to eliminate the consequences of the Russian missile attack.

As a result of the attack, 4 people were injured. One of the injured persons, a woman born in 1974, was hospitalized with an eye injury, multiple bruises on her face, and hand injuries. The woman was promptly operated on. The condition is stable, moderately severe. Other victims were also given the necessary medical assistance. Three people refused hospitalization.

The number of damaged objects has increased. Currently, there are 69 private houses. Most of them have partially broken windows, cut doors, roofs and walls. There are also almost completely destroyed houses. A number of apartments in 5 high-rise buildings in the region were damaged.

Facades, windows, fences of 2 lyceums of the region were also damaged due to falling debris. Classes at these institutions will be held online.

14 vehicles, 11 non-residential objects were damaged - medical laboratory, fences, garages, farm. rooms.

event: Launch of Civilian Drone Engine Production
description: The Federal Center for Unmanned Aviation in Moscow will begin producing light engines for civilian drones, with no Russian analogues. The first batch of 100 engines is ready, and up to 5,000 motors will be produced annually, meeting the industry's needs. The center, established last year, has 12 resident companies and design bureaus working on various projects, including delivery vehicles and UAV landing platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Our everything
The production of engines for civilian drones will be launched in Moscow. They will first begin to produce light engines, which have no analogues in Russia. The first batch of 100 copies is already ready. Up to 5,000 motors will be produced at the site per year, which will cover the industry’s needs for such devices. Production will be launched within the framework of the Federal Center for Unmanned Aviation. It was created last year on the basis of the Rudnevo industrial park near the Nekrasovka metro station. 12 companies and design bureaus have already become residents, the production of vehicles for delivering goods in adverse weather conditions, UAV landing platforms and other projects has begun.

description: Arthur Schubart, an amateur zoologist, attempted to breed giant sheep by using wild animal tissue from Kyrgyzstan and Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep. He aimed to sell these sheep to hunting grounds, but authorities intervened, ordering the animals to be quarantined and threatening Schubart with up to five years in prison and a $250,000 fine.
original:
“A Montana man used wild animal tissue to breed ‘giant’ sheep to sell to hunting grounds”: Americans became frightened of Frankenstein sheep, forcing an amateur zoologist to stop experiments.

Since 2013, 80-year-old Vaughan resident Arthur Schubart has been toying with the idea of creating a giant Frankenstein sheep - he decided that he would sell such sheep to hunting grounds that allow hunters to shoot rare animals bred in captivity on their territory.
To implement the idea, he purchased Pamir mountain sheep tissue from a hunter from Kyrgyzstan and bred a cloned embryo from the biomaterial, raising a purebred Pamir mountain sheep lamb from it. Schubart agreed to sell one of his descendants to Texas for 10 thousand dollars. The mountain ram's semen was then used to inseminate other sheep. Schubart also acquired biomaterial from Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep and attempted to develop a new species.
The authorities ordered the man to place all the animals that were obtained through crossing in quarantine. For each episode of illegal import of wild animals, a man could face up to five years in prison and a fine of $250,000.”
